content:
# The current state of the entities on the map shows that we have one Stone Furnace, which still has 3 coal remaining but is reporting a status of "NO_INGREDIENTS."
# This indicates that it has consumed most of its iron ore and is waiting for more ingredients to smelt.

# Since we have harvested Copper Ore, we can now use one of our Stone Furnaces to smelt Copper Ore into Copper Plates.
# However, we need to check the recipe for Copper Plate to confirm the requirements.

# Step 10: Check the recipe for Copper Plate.
copper_plate_recipe = get_prototype_recipe(Prototype.CopperPlate)
print(f"Copper Plate recipe: {copper_plate_recipe}")

# The Copper Plate recipe typically requires 1 Copper Ore to produce 1 Copper Plate.
# We have 10 Copper Ore, so we can smelt all of it into Copper Plates.

# Step 11: Insert Copper Ore into one of the Stone Furnaces.
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, stone_furnace, quantity=10)

# Verify the Stone Furnace inventory to ensure that the Copper Ore has been inserted correctly.
print(f"Stone Furnace inventory after inserting Copper Ore: {inspect_inventory(stone_furnace)}")

# Step 12: Wait for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait for smelting completion
    if inspect_inventory(stone_furnace)[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 10:  # Check if we produced enough copper plates
        print("Copper Plates have been crafted!")
        break
    sleep(1)

else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check furnace fuel and inputs.")

# Finally, we will check our overall inventory again.
print(f"Inventory after smelting Copper Plates: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
